p: The oils were dominated by phenylpropanoids, and were detected in all the accessions in all seasons but in different quantities. Interestingly, the β-asarone content was highest in winter (57.0–90.6%) and lowest in summer, except Bhimtal, in which spring has the lowest content; whereas the α-asarone content was highest in summer and lowest in winter in all the accessions. On the basis of major components (phenyl propanoids) analysis by cluster analysis, as in Figure 2, it was observed that there were little difference in principal components like α-asarone, Z-isoelemicin, β-asarone, etc., both altitude-wise and season-wise.
